saved_for_later.title: Shark Bite: Against the Odds (Against the Odds)
saved_for_later.author: Todd Strasser
saved_for_later.description: Adrift in shark-infested waters after a storm damages their sailboat and injures Mr. Green, the only adult on board, Ian and his sister Talia struggle for survival while facing a sinking boat, Mr. Green's deterioration, and dwindling supplies. Original.
saved_for_later.explanation: Based on your preference for Art and Juvenile Fiction genres, and your enjoyment of Betsy B. Lee's 10,000 White Horses, I recommend 'Shark Bite: Against the Odds'. This book, by Todd Strasser, is a Juvenile Fiction title that shares the engaging storytelling and adventure elements of your liked book. Despite being in a different genre, Science Fiction, it aligns with your interests.

saved_for_later.title: Remember Me 2: The Return
saved_for_later.author: Christopher Pike
saved_for_later.description: Shari Cooper, a murder victim, is given the opportunity to return to Earth in the shape of a Wanderer, and inhabit the body of a depressed girl, but must confront those who regard Wanderers with hostility and violence. Simultaneous.
saved_for_later.explanation: Based on your preference for Art and Juvenile Fiction, I recommend "Remember Me 2: The Return" by Christopher Pike. This book shares your interest in Juvenile Fiction, and its unique blend of Science Fiction elements may appeal to your taste for the Art genre. The story revolves around a character given a second chance, which could resonate with your enjoyment of "10,000 White Horses".

saved_for_later.title: Old Sins
saved_for_later.author: Penny Vincenzi
saved_for_later.description: _____________________________ POWER Two clever, stylish and ambitious women are fighting for control of a multi-million cosmetics empire. MYSTERY What is the secret that lies behind its charming, ruthless creator, Julian Morell? And why, when he dies, does he leave half his forturne to a complete stranger? GLAMOUR Here are the designer interiors, the jewels, cars and to-die-for couture of the rich and the super-rich - the glittering, fabulous world Julian created for himself, and the women who loved him. PASSION And here is a love story - poignant, sexy, tempestuous - featuring a mother, a mistress, a wife and a daughter, all of whom are overshadowed by ... old sins. PRAISE FOR PENNY VINCENZI "This super-glossy first novel...catches the passing reflection, the sheen and glitter of things, spying out the trends...make no mistake, this is contemporary writing" Guardian "Like a glass of champagne: bubbly, moreish and you don't want it to end... A fantastic read" Daily Express "Penny is the doyenne of the modern blockbuster" Glamour
saved_for_later.explanation: Based on your reading history, you have a preference for fiction genres. The recommended book, "Old Sins" by Penny Vincenzi, also falls under the fiction genre. Additionally, your liked books include titles with intriguing plots and elements of mystery, which is reflected in "Old Sins" with its story of two women fighting for control of a cosmetics empire and the secret behind its creator. Despite your preference for fiction, you have not shown a strong leaning towards any specific sub-genres, such as science fiction or noir, which "Old Sins" also incorporates. This book's combination of mystery, intrigue, and fiction aligns well with your reading history.

saved_for_later.title: Blood and Gold: The Vampire Marius (The Vampire Chronicles)
saved_for_later.author: Anne Rice
saved_for_later.description: The former mentor to the vampire Lestat tells his story, which begins in the ancient Roman Empire when he is made a "blood god" by the Druids and follows him through the darkest, bloodiest centuries of European history. 750,000 first printing.
saved_for_later.explanation: Based on your preference for Art and Juvenile Fiction genres, and your enjoyment of Betsy B. Lee's '10,000 White Horses', I recommend 'Blood and Gold: The Vampire Marius' by Anne Rice. This book, like your liked title, offers a unique narrative experience. While it is not a juvenile fiction or an art book per se, it shares the engaging storytelling style that resonated with you in '10,000 White Horses'. Additionally, its historical context and mythological elements may appeal to your interest in art and general reading.

saved_for_later.title: Around Elvis
saved_for_later.author: Robert Wells
saved_for_later.description: A very different view of the world of Elvis Presley is presented in these comic fictional stories. His manager, Colonel Parker, his family and the Memphis Mafia all feature in episodes such as the siege of Graceland when the military police try to arrest Elvis. Fans of the King of Rock and Roll will learn of Liberace's hair-raising encounter with Elvis's pet chimpanzee, screen legend Greta Garbo coming out of retirement to make a film musical, and the invitation from HM The Queen to Elvis to attend the Royal Highland Games. Some stories are based on real events, such as the Million Dollar Quartet and being drafted into the army, but here they are given a comic twist. They are written by a lifelong fan who asks: Who'd have thought Elvis and life at Graceland could be so funny.
saved_for_later.explanation: Based on your reading history, you've shown a preference for juvenile fiction, particularly in the genres of science fiction and fantasy. The recommended book, 'Around Elvis', aligns with your genre interest, but it's categorized under 'Fiction / Fairy Tales, Folk Tales, Legends & Mythology'. This book's comic fictional stories about Elvis Presley might offer a fresh perspective for you, as you've enjoyed various authors and books with unique narratives in your liked list. Despite its genre difference, the comic twist and Elvis connection make it a suitable recommendation.
